conclusion: Analyze motion based on acceleration-time graph.
Acceleration increases linearly from 0 to a0 from t=0 to t=t0/2.
Acceleration decreases linearly from a0 to 0 from t=t0/2 to t=t0.
Acceleration decreases linearly from 0 to -a0 from t=t0 to t=3t0/2.
Acceleration increases linearly from -a0 to 0 from t=3t0/2 to t=2t0.
Velocity is the integral of acceleration.
Calculate velocity from t=0 to t=t0/2: v(t) = (a0/t0)t^2.
Calculate velocity from t=t0/2 to t=t0: v(t) = a0t - (a0/t0)t^2.
Calculate velocity from t=t0 to t=3t0/2: v(t) = -(a0/t0)t^2 + 2a0t - a0t0.
Calculate velocity from t=3t0/2 to t=2t0: v(t) = (a0/t0)t^2 - 4a0t + 17a0t0/4.
Position is the integral of velocity.
Calculate position from t=0 to t=t0/2: x(t) = (a0/3t0)t^3.
Calculate position from t=t0/2 to t=t0.
